item.title: Opinion: 'Free speech doesn't work just when you agree with it'
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon recalls a First Amendment case from the late 1970s involving the rights of a neo-Nazi group to march through a predominantly Jewish suburb of Chicago.

item.title: NPR-Ipsos poll: Americans don't broadly support Trump's National Guard deployments

item.title: How the beloved state fair grew from livestock showcases to cornucopias of amusement
item.description: The state fair dates back to the 1800s, and its agricultural roots go back even further. Ever since, states have been putting their own spin on the annual event while staying true to tradition.

item.title: Assata Shakur, a fugitive Black militant sought by the U.S. since 1979, dies in Cuba
item.description: Assata Shakur, a Black liberation activist who was given political asylum in Cuba after her 1979 escape from a U.S. prison, has died. Officials in New Jersey, where Shakur had been arrested, convicted and imprisoned, said she was 78.
